abstract: He owns 11.5 percent of DreamWorks Animation but has 60 percent of the shareholder vote, which gives him control in a sale to NBCUniversal.
snippet: He owns 11.5 percent of DreamWorks Animation but has 60 percent of the shareholder vote, which gives him control in a sale to NBCUniversal.
lead_paragraph: Jeffrey Katzenberg, the chief executive and controlling shareholder of DreamWorks Animation, cut himself a nice side deal at the expense of DreamWorks shareholders, according to a recent lawsuit filed in Delaware Chancery Court over the company’s $3.8 billion sale to Comcast’s NBCUniversal.

headline.main: Lawsuit Aims at Jeffrey Katzenberg and His Dual-Class Shares
